did.unittitle: Jennifer (Sudie) Nostrand Papers

physdesc.extent: in 5 record cartons, 3 manuscript boxes, 1 half manuscript box, 1 small case, 1 oversize flat box, and 1 oversize folder in shared housing

did.abstract: Jennifer (Sudie) Nostrand is a New York poet whose work has been published in literary magazines such as The California Quarterly, The Greensboro Review, and the Manhattan Poetry Review. Nostrand earned her Ph.D. in English Literature from New York University. The Jennifer (Sudie) Nostrand Papers largely consist of published copies of Nostrand's poetry from 1965 to 2013, with a selection of unpublished materials related to the editing, publication, or review of her work.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
The records are arranged in four series. The contents of each series are arranged chronologically by their publication date, or date of creation for papers. The collection was processed at the folder-level. The series arrangement of the records is as follows:
Series I, Documents, 1965-2013
Series II, Printed Materials, 1965-2013, undated
Series III, Oversized Materials, 1982-1988
Series IV, Data Storage, 2001-2005, undated

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jennifer (Sudie) Nostrand is a New York poet whose work has been published in such literary magazines as The California Quarterly, The Greensboro Review, the Manhattan Poetry Reviewâ€”among many others.

In 1984, Nostrand released Joan, a piece on the French heroine Joan of Arc, with the Mimeograph Press as part of the St. Mark's Church-in-the-Bowery's Poetry Project. The March Street Press later published a collection of her works entitled The Paris Poems in 2004 and in 2010 Nostrand released Variations with the same independent publisher. In response to The Paris Poems, American poet, editor, and activist, Ron Kolm claimed that, "Sudie Nostrand has that very rare ability to make the spiritual manifest (The Paris Poems)."

Nostrand earned a Ph.D. in English Literature from New York University. In addition to her published work, Nostrand participated in various public readings in New York City. She has gone by various names throughout her career: Jennifer Nostrand, Jennifer Sudie Nostrand, S. Nostrand, and, simply, Sudie.
Sources: Nostrand, Sudie."Biography." Variations, Greensboro, North Carolina: March Street Press, 2010. Nostrand, Sudie. The Paris Poems, Greensboro, North Carolina: March Street Press, 2004.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Jennifer (Sudie) Nostrand between 2000-2019. The accession numbers associated with these gifts are 2000.082, 2005.082, 2006.082, 2019.020, and 2019.034.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Jennifer (Sudie) Nostrand Papers; MSS 082; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2019 have not been recorded. In 2019, certain materials were placed in new acid-free folders and boxes. Materials that were loose was foldered and titled. Original caption information, when available, was transcribed onto acid-free archival folders. Where captions were illegible, the archivist's interpretation is enclosed in square brackets. All materials were organized in the order the content was received.

Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. New York University Libraries follow professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity and authenticity of the content.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Jennifer (Sudie) Nostrand Papers contain copies of Nostrand's published poetry from 1965 to 2013. The collection also includes unpublished materials and electronic files related to the editing, publication, or review of her work.

controlaccess.subject: American poetry -- 20th century -- Periodicals
Poets -- United States.
controlaccess.corpname: St. Mark's Church In-the-Bowery (New York, N.Y.). Poetry Project

did.unittitle: Series I: Documents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains papers related to Jennifer (Sudie) Nostrand's writing, such as posters, flyers, listings, reviews, correspondence, editorial proofs, and copies of a personal bibliography.

Series II: Printed Materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of original publications featuring Nostrand's writings from 1965-2013.

Series III: Oversized Materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series includes print materials, such as oversized publications, which are too large to be stored in record cartons.

Series IV: Data Storage
did.physdesc: Prior to 2019, it was documented that the collection included two floppy disks, yet it remains unknown as to the physical location of or the exact media types of these items. It is assumed that these two floppy disks are situated within files in the collection boxes. As of 2019, there were two 3.5" floppy disks incorporated into the collection from accession 2019.020, which were removed using a Digital Media Separation Sheet and have been transferred to the shared container "Born-Digital (Separated from ACCNS)" located on the work shelves at the 20 Cooper Square offsite facility.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series includes electronic files which include Nostrand's bibliography dated January 2005, and other unpublished writings from 2001.

did.unittitle: Nostrand's Bibliography
